::: {.cell}

:::


::: {.cell}

:::

This page provides information about the valid indicative distribution map for the ecosystem functional group [**MT3.1 Artificial shorelines**](/efg-info/MT3_1.qmd). For older or alternative maps, see [here](/altmap-info/MT3_1_history.qmd).

## Methods

Here is the methods summary for **Map code and version**: MT3.1.web.map v1.0.

> Marine ecoregions (Spalding et al. 2008) containing major and minor occurrences of urbanized shorelines were identified from the map of night lights (see T7.4), imagery available on Google Earth and expertise of authors. Occurrences were aggregated to 1 degree spatial resolution and intersected with the coastline to exclude areas inland and in the open ocean.

::: {.cell}

:::



::: {.cell}

:::



### Datasets

**MEOW-2008** (Spalding MD et al.  2008):

Source of _biogeographical range_.
 Resolution: variable (polygons), static.
 Accuracy evaluation: qualitative (experts judgement).

::: {.cell}
::: {.cell-output-display}


|dataset   |url                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                     |
|:---------|:---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------|
|MEOW-2008 |<https://www.worldwildlife.org/publications/marine-ecoregions-of-the-world-a-bioregionalization-of-coastal-and-shelf-areas>{target='links'} :: <https://databasin.org/datasets/3b6b12e7bcca419990c9081c0af254a2>{target='links'} :: <http://maps.tnc.org/gis_data.html>{target='links'} |


:::
:::

### Processing

Processing steps used in this map are: *Thresholds* :: *Clipping* :: *Selection*.

### Map evaluation


This map is considered to be a ***Coarse quality map*** based on the following characteristics:

Concept alignment is *Indirect,general*.

Ground observations are _NA_.

 The accuracy evaluation *Quantitative accuracy assessment,undocumented*.

## How to use the data

### Available files

:::{.aside}

Following maps are considered current and valid indicative distribution maps for this ecosystem functional group. `Web navigation` maps are optimised for use in webapps, but they have similar methods and differ only in details of format and processing. 

- Indicative Map (**code: MT3.1.IM.grid**, version v2.0) 
 - Web navigation (**code: MT3.1.web.map**, version v1.0) 


:::

You can download geospatial data for this map from the following sources:

**MT3.1.IM.grid** (v2.0): [Google Cloud bucket](gs://iucn_get_l3_im/MT3.1.IM.grid_v2.0.tif){target="gisdata"} :: [Zenodo repository (bundle of maps)](http://doi.org/10.5281/zenodo.3958934){target="gisdata"}

**MT3.1.web.map** (v1.0): [Google Cloud bucket](gs://iucn_get_l3_im/MT3.1.web.map_v1.0.tif){target="gisdata"} :: [Zenodo repository (bundle of maps)](http://doi.org/10.5281/zenodo.5090419){target="gisdata"} :: [Zenodo repository (EFG map)](https://doi.org/10.5281/zenodo.5091115){target="gisdata"} :: [Mapbox tileset](https://studio.mapbox.com/tilesets/jrfep.MT3_1_web_map){target="gisdata"} :: [Earth Engine assets](projects/earthengine-legacy/assets/users/jrferrerparis/IUCN-GET/L3_IndMaps/){target="gisdata"}

Note that you need to login to some services like [mapbox](https://www.mapbox.com){target="links"} or [earthengine](https://earthengine.google.com){target="links"}, and in some cases you also need to request access to the files.

###  License information

Indicative maps have been released with a ![](https://zenodo.org/static/icons/licenses/cc-by-icon.svg){height=20} Creative Commons Attribution 4.0 International license. 

Datasets used to create this map might have some restriction for commercial use, see details below.


::: {.cell}
::: {.cell-output-display}

|:---------|:--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------|
|MEOW-2008 |Creative Commons Attribution-NonCommercial 3.0 License :: https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-nc/3.0 |


:::
:::

## References

References used in this version of the maps.

- *VIIRS Day/Night Band Nighttime Lights*, Version 1; **Earth Observation Group, NOAA National Centers for Environmental Information (NCEI)**. [Data-set]( https://eogdata.mines.edu/download_dnb_composites.html)

DOI:[10.1641/B570707](https://doi.org/10.1641/B570707)
